column4: Is there something like the System Monitor's Processes tab that can give real-time statistics on which processes are sending/receiving data, and the amount?
(Sending and receiving, as in, network activity.)
Is netstat different from Network Tool's "Netstat" tab?
I'm not sure if the Network Tools uses the netstat command; I do know that using netstat from the command line will offer you MUCH more flexibility in analyzing activity
netstat from the command line can check traffic by protocol, by port, show you which processes are associated with it, states...you name it
okay, but how can I get a "top" like output from it?
What traffic are you trying to find?  Are you trying to fix a specific problem?  If so lemme know what it is and I can try to help you find the best way to debug it
Ok just a sec, I'll try to write up a sort for you
basically I just want to see which processes are making traffic, and how much :) it's not for any actual admin purposes.
ok, that should be pretty easy; just a sec
I'm not sure if netstat will be the best one for live monitoring; most of my uses for it are in debugging, like checking which process is creating traffic on a certain port
To analyze broader trends, you might be better off with a program like Wireshark
okay, thanks for your help -- I'll check out wireshark :)
Wireshark is a great network auditing tool, since you can write filters to find very specific activity, and then drill down and analyze the actual data packets
So you could see what's making traffic, and also what data it's sending and to where
If you use wireshark just remember you'll probably need to run it as root
Thanks again.  Looks like a complex app, I'll have to see if I can figure it out.
